data.event: Cumberland was settled in 1837 and named Poor Fork, for its location on a fork of the Cumberland River with relatively poor soil.

event.title: the coal mining boom of the 1900s

data.event: It remained isolated until the coal mining boom of the 1900s when railroads connected it with surrounding towns.
The city is also served by Rebecca Caudill Public Library, first established in 1965 in an old store building on Myers Street.
In 1972, the Cumberland Branch moved to a newly constructed building, located on Main St., funded by state library funds.

event.title: 1995, an addition to this construction was completed

data.event: In 1995, an addition to this construction was completed.
